Package com.tdc

Interface IComponent<T extends IComponentObserver>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of listeners used for this component. For a component whose class is X, its corresponding listener interface would typically be XObserver.
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCoinDispenser, AbstractComponent, CoinDispenserBronze, CoinDispenserGold, CoinSlot, CoinStorageUnit, CoinTray, CoinValidator
public interface IComponent<T extends IComponentObserver>
Base type for all components from TDC.

This class utilizes the Observer design pattern. Subclasses inherit the attach method, but each must define its own notifyXXX methods.

Each component must be coupled to an appropriate listener interface, which extends AbstractcomponentObserver; the type parameter T represents this listener.

Any individual component can be disabled, which means it will not permit physical movements to be caused by the software. Any method that could cause a physical movement will declare that it throws DisabledException.

Author:
TDC, Inc.

  • Method Details

    • isConnected

      boolean isConnected()
      Checks whether this component is connected to the power grid.
      Returns:
      true if this component is connected; otherwise, false.

    • isActivated

      boolean isActivated()
      Checks whether this component is activated.
      Returns:
      true if the component is activated; otherwise, false.

    • hasPower

      boolean hasPower()
      Checks whether this component is connected to a power grid that has power.
      Returns:
      true if the component is connected to a grid that has power; otherwise, false.

    • connect

      void connect(PowerGrid grid)
      Connects this component to the electrical power grid, leaving the power off. If the component is already connected or if it is already activated, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      grid - The grid to connect to. Must not be null. Must have power.

    • disconnect

      void disconnect()
      Disconnects this component from the electrical power grid. Disconnection also disactivates the component. If the component is already disconnected, this method does nothing.

    • activate

      void activate()
      Attempts to turn on the power to this component. This does not guarantee that the component is plugged in and receiving power.

    • disactivate

      void disactivate()
      Attempts to turn off the power to this component. If the component is already disactivated or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing.

    • detach

      boolean detach(T observer)
      Locates the indicated observer and removes it such that it will no longer be informed of events from this component. If the observer is not currently registered with this component, calls to this method will return false, but otherwise have no effect.
      Parameters:
      observer - The observer to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the observer was found and removed, false otherwise.

    • detachAll

      void detachAll()
      All observers registered with this component are removed. If there are none, calls to this method have no effect.

    • attach

      void attach(T observer)
      Registers the indicated observer to receive event notifications from this component.
      Parameters:
      observer - The observer to be added.
      Throws:
      NullPointerSimulationException - If the argument is null.

    • disable

      void disable()
      Disables this component from receiving input and producing output. Announces "disabled" event. Requires power.

    • enable

      void enable()
      Enables this component for receiving input and producing output. Announces "enabled" event. Requires power.

    • isDisabled

      boolean isDisabled()
      Returns whether this component is currently disabled from receiving input and producing output. Requires power.
      Returns:
      true if the component is disabled; false if the component is enabled.
